poem:
Good Boy

A dog, heart keen,  
paws whisper on twilight's edge—  
swift sentinel,  
alert to shadows that linger  
beyond the soft pulse of the hearth.  
Silent, the air clots  
with unspoken dread.  
Heroic, he bounds  
into night's quiet chorus,  
a pure note against  
the dissonant creep  
of encroaching dark.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Good Boy review – crafty supernatural horror leads with a heroic dog In the horror genre, you’d be a fool to ignore the concerns of a dog. While cats are mainly lurking in dark spaces waiting to collaborate with the orchestra on a cheap jumpscare, dogs are quick to alert their owners of nefarious goings on, acutely sensitive to threats whether they be human or not. Related: Play Dirty review – Shane Black’s action comedy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Good Boy review – crafty supernatural horror leads with a heroic dog In the horror genre, you’d be a fool to ignore the concerns of a dog.
